segment.source: Update Product Status (Windows 10)
segment.target: Update Product Status (Windows 10)

segment.source: Update Product Status
segment.target: Update Product Status

segment.source: Update Product Status
segment.target: Update Product Status

segment.source: After you add computers to the VAMT database, you need to use the Update license status function to add the products that are installed on the computers.
segment.target: After you add computers to the VAMT database, you need to use the Update license status function to add the products that are installed on the computers.

segment.source: You can also use the Update license status at any time to retrieve the most current license status for any products in the VAMT database.
segment.target: You can also use the Update license status at any time to retrieve the most current license status for any products in the VAMT database.

segment.source: To retrieve license status, VAMT must have administrative permissions on all selected computers and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) must be accessible through the Windows Firewall.
segment.target: To retrieve license status, VAMT must have administrative permissions on all selected computers and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) must be accessible through the Windows Firewall.

segment.source: In addition, for workgroup computers, a registry key must be created to enable remote administrative actions under User Account Control (UAC).
segment.target: In addition, for workgroup computers, a registry key must be created to enable remote administrative actions under User Account Control (UAC).

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Client Computers.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The license-status query requires a valid computer name for each system queried.
segment.target: The license-status query requires a valid computer name for each system queried.

segment.source: If the VAMT database contains computers that were added without Personally Identifiable Information, computer names will not be available for those computers, and the status for these computers will not be updated.
segment.target: If the VAMT database contains computers that were added without Personally Identifiable Information, computer names will not be available for those computers, and the status for these computers will not be updated.

segment.source: Update the license status of a product
segment.target: Update the license status of a product

segment.source: Open VAMT.
segment.target: Open VAMT.

segment.source: In the Products list, select one or more products that need to have their status updated.
segment.target: In the Products list, select one or more products that need to have their status updated.

segment.source: In the right-side Actions pane, click Update license status and then click a credential option.
segment.target: In the right-side Actions pane, click Update license status and then click a credential option.

segment.source: Choose Alternate Credentials only if you are updating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you used to log into the computer.
segment.target: Choose Alternate Credentials only if you are updating products that require administrator credentials different from the ones you used to log into the computer.

segment.source: If you are supplying alternate credentials, in the Windows Security dialog box type the appropriate user name and password and click OK.
segment.target: If you are supplying alternate credentials, in the Windows Security dialog box type the appropriate user name and password and click OK.

segment.source: VAMT displays the Collecting product information dialog box while it collects the status of all selected products.
segment.target: VAMT displays the Collecting product information dialog box while it collects the status of all selected products.

segment.source: When the process is finished, the updated licensing status of each product will appear in the product list view in the center pane.
segment.target: When the process is finished, the updated licensing status of each product will appear in the product list view in the center pane.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If a previously discovered Microsoft Office 2010 product has been uninstalled from the remote computer, updating its licensing status will cause the entry to be deleted from the Office product list view, and, consequently, the total number of discovered products will be smaller.
segment.target: If a previously discovered Microsoft Office 2010 product has been uninstalled from the remote computer, updating its licensing status will cause the entry to be deleted from the Office product list view, and, consequently, the total number of discovered products will be smaller.

segment.source: However, the Windows installation of the same computer will not be deleted and will always be shown in the Windows products list view.
segment.target: However, the Windows installation of the same computer will not be deleted and will always be shown in the Windows products list view.
